title: Vortex
copy: Students from MOSAIC art program assisted in creating a 218-foot-long mural featured on the side of an underpass. "Vortex" — painted in a studio and affixed on the underpass in pieces— was completed 2013. Artist: Alex Rubio. Location: Nolan St. underpass between Chestnut St. And N. Cherry St.

title: Spirit of a Leader
copy: "Spirit of a Leader"— a photo-turned-mural of Martin Luther King Jr.'s speech "I've Been to the Mountaintop" — was completed in 2013. "Spirit of a Leader" is featured at the beginning of San Antonio's annual Martin Luther King's march every January. Artist: David Blancas. Location: 3518 Martin Luther King Dr.

title: Fiesta
copy: The "Fiesta" mural features local makeup artist Bianca Flores, who won Red Bull's competition showcasing how she celebrates Fiesta. "Fiesta" was completed in 2017 by the Los Otros duo. Artist: Nik Soupe and Shek Vega. Location: 2611 Broadway St.

title: Beneath it All
copy: On the side of the San Antonio Current builfing, a weekly publication, is the first large-scale project of Los Otros duo. Creating their signature look with bright colors and sophisticated black and white, "Beneath it All" was completed in 2014. Artist: Nik Soupe and Shek Vega. Location: 915 Dallas St.

title: Spirit of a Leader
copy: The world's first 3-D mural features aspects from San Antonio community members as they believe the future of the city will look. "Vision del Futuro" was completed in 2013 and features a 3-D glasses sculpture in front of the mural. Artist: John Medina. Location: 203 E Fredericksburg Road

title: Selena
copy: At the age of 19, Montoya freestyled the Texas native musician Selena Quintanilla-Perez on the wall of a strip mall in his childhood neighborhood. The mural, "Selena," was completed in 2012. Artist: Chris Montoya. Location: 4913 S Flores St.

title: S.A. Wall
copy: "S.A. Wall" was completed just in time for the 2014 Spurs championship win. This S.A. hometown-pride mural features the Spurs throwback colors, the S.A. skyline, the Texas flag and a remix of the Spurs logo. Artist: Can2. Location: Interstate 10 Frontage Road between Fulton Ave. and W. Hildebrand Ave.

title: Mujerista
copy: "Mujerista" features women of empowerment and reminds women that what happens today will affect their tomorrow. Completed in 2016, "Mujerista" creates the bridge between the West and East side murals. Artist: Jane Madrigal and Rabbit Rye. Location: 2603 E. Houston St.

title: La Musica de San Anto
copy: A gateway between the East and the West side, "La Musica de San Anto" memorializes local musical artists who have made their mark in the city. "La Musica de San Anto" was completed in 2008. Artist: David Blancas. Location: 1303 W. Commerce
